reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Strengthening the HIV and TB National Response

description.narrative: Egypt - TB/HIV. This program has the following goals: Reduce TB incidence by 50% by 2025 compared to 2015 (15 cases / 100 000 population). Reduce the number of TB death by 75% by 2025 compared to 2015. To reduce catastrophic cost on patients and their families from 24% in 2019 to 0% by 2025. “End the AIDS” epidemic as a public health threat by 2030 within the context of ensuring healthy lives and promoting well-being for all at all ages. The objectives of this program are: To strengthen the existing system to provide universal access to TB prevention, care and control by increasing access to newer diagnostic and treatment services.. To achieve reduction in new HIV infections, including among key populations. To reduce TB deaths among people living with HIV. To ensure that 95% of people living with HIV know their virus status. To ensure that 95% of people diagnosed with HIV are receiving ART. To ensure that 95% people diagnosed with HIV on treatment achieve viral load suppression

title.narrative: Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of men who have sex with men that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Percentage of people who inject drugs reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of people who inject drugs that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of people living with HIV newly initiated on ART who were screened for TB
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among prisoners
Percentage of new and relapse TB patients tested using WHO recommended rapid tests at the time of diagnosis
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among key affected populations/ high risk groups (other than prisoners)
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
